## 🌍 Top 5 Global Fintech News

- **[Fintech founder charged with fraud; AI app found to be humans in the Philippines](https://techcrunch.com/2025/04/10/fintech-founder-charged-with-fraud-after-ai-shopping-app-found-to-be-powered-by-humans-in-the-philippines/)** — *Hacker News* — A fintech founder faces fraud charges after their supposed AI-powered shopping app was revealed to be operated by human workers in the Philippines.

- **[Americans see their savings vanish in Synapse fintech crisis](https://www.cnbc.com/2024/11/22/synapse-bankruptcy-thousands-of-americans-see-their-savings-vanish.html)** — *Hacker News* — Thousands of Americans lost access to their savings following the collapse of Banking-as-a-Service middleware provider Synapse, raising serious questions about fintech consumer protections.

- **[Apple acquires UK open banking startup Credit Kudos](https://ffnews.com/newsarticle/apple-acquires-uk-open-banking-startup-credit-kudos/)** — *Hacker News* — Apple has acquired UK-based open banking startup Credit Kudos, signalling the tech giant's growing ambitions in financial data and credit assessment.

- **[Open Banking and Payments Competition](https://www.bitsaboutmoney.com/archive/open-banking-and-payments-competition/)** — *Hacker News* — A deep-dive analysis explores how open banking frameworks are reshaping competition in the payments landscape globally.

- **[Fintech is making credit cards weirder](https://workweek.com/2022/08/05/fintech-is-making-credit-cards-weirder/)** — *Hacker News* — Fintech innovation is driving a new wave of unconventional credit card products, blurring the lines between traditional credit and embedded finance offerings.

## 🍁 Top 5 Canadian Fintech News

- **[XTM Reports on Everyday People Payments Service Outage and Halting of Activities Pursuant to Bank of Canada Compliance Order](https://financialpost.com/pmn/business-wire-news-releases-pmn/xtm-reports-on-everyday-people-payments-service-outage-and-halting-of-activities-pursuant-to-bank-of-canada-compliance-order)** — *Financial Post* — Canadian fintech XTM Inc. has halted its Everyday People payments service following a January outage and a compliance order from the Bank of Canada, raising concerns about regulatory oversight in the payments sector.

- **[Capital concentrates as Canadian VC market narrows: report](https://betakit.com/capital-concentrates-as-canadian-vc-market-narrows-report/)** — *BetaKit* — A new report finds that venture capital investment in Canada is increasingly flowing to a smaller number of deals and firms, with implications for early-stage fintech startups seeking funding.

- **[Wagepoint rolls out two new additions to its payroll software](https://betakit.com/wagepoint-rolls-out-two-new-additions-to-its-payroll-software/)** — *BetaKit* — Canadian payroll fintech Wagepoint has launched two new features to its platform, continuing to expand its embedded finance offerings for small businesses.

- **[Canada's annual inflation rate edged down to 2.3% in January with decline in gas prices](https://www.cbc.ca/news/business/canada-inflation-cpi-january-2026-9.7093329?cmp=rss)** — *CBC Business* — Canada's inflation rate dipped to 2.3% in January 2026, a macroeconomic signal relevant to Bank of Canada rate decisions and consumer lending conditions across the country.

- **[Canada calls screen scraping 'unsecure,' sets Open Banking target for 2023](https://finledger.com/2021/08/09/canada-sets-open-banking-target-for-2023/)** — *Hacker News* — *(Included for ongoing relevance)* Canada's push to move beyond screen scraping toward a formal open banking framework remains a foundational issue as the country's consumer-driven banking regime continues to take shape.
